title: Engine Electronic Control Module (ECM) - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
When disconnecting a connector, never pull directly on the wires as this may result in cable and connector damage.
Disconnect the MAP and intake air temperature sensor electrical connections.
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position as this may cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect an ECM after disconnecting the battery negative (black) lead first.
Gently push the carrier bracket locking tabs forward to release the ECM.
Slide the engine ECM forwards and upwards to release it from the carrier bracket.
Disconnect the three electrical connectors from the engine ECM (see
Engine ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering

search: Engine Electronic Control Module (ECM) - Removal
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Perform the following operations:
Turn the ignition to the OFF position and wait at least 1 minute for the engine ECM to complete its power down sequence.
Seats - Removal
Battery - Removal
Ambient Air Pressure Sensor - Removal
When disconnecting a connector, never pull directly on the wires as this may result in cable and connector damage.
Disconnect the MAP and intake air temperature sensor electrical connections.
Never disconnect an ECM when the ignition switch is in the ON position as this may cause multiple fault codes to be logged in the ECM memory.
Always disconnect an ECM after disconnecting the battery negative (black) lead first.
Gently push the carrier bracket locking tabs forward to release the ECM.
Slide the engine ECM forwards and upwards to release it from the carrier bracket.
Engine ECM
Electrical connectors
Locking tabs
Disconnect the three electrical connectors from the engine ECM (see
Engine ECM Electrical Connector Disconnect/Reconnect and Pin Numbering
) and remove the ECM.
